@khtruong  and @xtinec why the code was reverted? Any explanation.
You seem to be missing this: https://superset.incubator.apache.org/installation.html?highlight=results_backend
I'm still getting a " TypeError: unhashable type 'dict' " while using three different metrics for X, Y and bubble size.

I'm not sure why cypress test has failed:
```
CypressError: Timed out retrying: Expected to find element: '.SouthPane .ReactVirtualized__Table', but never found it.
```

The PR should not change anything related to SQLlab UI.

you can use the below code and place this code under the views/core.py file. and Gamma user will be able to see his chart .

Class name is slicefilter

def apply(self, query, func): # noqa
if security_manager.all_datasource_access():
return query
perms = self.get_view_menus("datasource_access")
Dash = models.Dashboard
User = ab_models.User
Slice = models.Slice # noqa

    # TODO(bogdan): add `schema_access` support here
    user_roles = [role.name.lower() for role in list(self.get_user_roles())]
    datasource_perms = self.get_view_menus("datasource_access")
    all_datasource_access = security_manager.all_datasource_access()
    owner_ids_query = (
        db.session.query(Slice.id)
        .join(Slice.owners)
        .filter(User.id == User.get_user_id())
    )

    query = query.filter(
        or_(
            Slice.id.in_(owner_ids_query),
        )
    )

    return query
Let me know if you are facing any problem..
still i am having same issue .even i followed above steps.
This is still an open issue imo. By reverting source and target metrics the problem persists. Could it be necessary to pre-format the data in any way?

Hi @trepmag,

I'm able to reproduce this, investigating...
I think you need to commit (remembering a related discussion some time ago). Perhaps we should add an option to autocommit in the datasource settings?

May be that, I've checked and the correct query gets to `db_engine_specs.execute`, and (of course) also makes it to PG.

I've added a `COMMIT` on the execute and it does work, :+1: @villebro. PG does some complaining around it:
```
2019-10-09 17:20:52.304 UTC [122] WARNING:  there is no transaction in progress
```
Yes making it optional per datasource does seem like a good option

Was this fundamentally the wrong solution, or is it just a bug in the PR? Feels like fixing the problem would be a better solution than reverting..
Just a bug in the PR - I'll fix the problem soon, but this is breaking deploys, so for now, it might be better to revert it just to keep things consistent.
gotcha
Thanks @dpgaspar It worked :)
This is probably just the unreliable js test acting up. I restarted it, should be ok.

Very weird warning, considering it clearly has something to commit. Looked around and stumbled across this, related perhaps? https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28593685/why-does-this-postgresql-transaction-give-warning-there-is-no-transaction-in-p
Is there currently REST API support or external CSV support to use as a data source?  If not, are there any workarounds to using external data not from a traditional database?
@stale It's only stale if it's been fixed ^^
+1 for this feature, its quite meaningful for me.

I seem to face the same problem as well:

![treemap error 10 10 2019](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46438728/66544736-882a1c80-eb6b-11e9-81bf-5d4d2c96a9cc.PNG)

Environment :-
superset version: `0.34.0`
python version: `Python 3.6.8`
node.js version: `v10.16.0`
npm version: `6.9.0`

It is also not interactive as previous version
Does anyone knows the solution..?

I think adding the option under `Database` would be a unintrusive way of fixing this, having it right under "Allow DML" along with a clear and concise description.
Would you be able to post some screenshots? I think step charts would be an awesome addition, as they seem to be all the rage for decomposing financials these days.

We'll work on getting 19.9.1 out ASAP.

@villebro which is the regression around SSL terminated LBs? I'd like to get that resolved, too.

Thanks for checking in @tilgovi! It is my understanding that the cherry that fixes the issue is https://github.com/benoitc/gunicorn/commit/e179dc25759405159e0bedbf6a0780eff2e5f043 . I haven't tested it myself, but if you check my comment in https://github.com/benoitc/gunicorn/issues/2022, running `curl -v -H "X-Forwarded-Proto: https" http://url` should return `https://` if the regression is fixed (currently `19.9.0` returns `http://`). Please let me know if you need my help testing the `19.9.1` RC.
Two PRs are preferable.
@villebro you can try out the branch at benoitc/gunicorn#2114 if you want to provide early feedback. It includes the referenced commit.
Sure thing @tilgovi , I'll post my results on the PR thread.

Linking this comment here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/8346#issuecomment-538508719

Maybe this should be in a separate plugin instead so that we don't update the deprecated `viz.py` file

You can solve this issue in a simple way;
first change your data connection to:
`    postgresql+psycopg2://username:XXXXXXXXXX@database_server_name:5432/database`

them in the extra parameters
```
{
"metadata_params": {},
"engine_params": {"isolation_level":"AUTOCOMMIT"},
"metadata_cache_timeout": {},
"schemas_allowed_for_csv_upload": []
}

```

I have also found same issue. I have configured time offset into data source configuration to 11(Australia/Melbourne). After configuration, still I am not able to get the data according to the time offset. I am using druid cluster.

@ericandrewmeadows version from git in file superset/assets/package.json is "0.999.0dev" 
@viveksatasiya I am using the postgresql database and as a workaround, I set my time zone for the user connecting to the database
oh! excellent thank you @rc-ontruck simple is beautiful. I've tested it and it solves the problem, @trepmag can you confirm?

Update on the issue (Thanks: @rc-ontruck), this can be simply solved by using:

```
{
"metadata_params": {},
"engine_params": {"isolation_level":"AUTOCOMMIT"},
"metadata_cache_timeout": {},
"schemas_allowed_for_csv_upload": []
}
```
This checks my second option, that I think it's less intrusive. Going to update docs to refer to this

Absolutely, it woks!

with x as (

        1 as mycol
    from dummy

Hi @mingyumkim93 , this could be more of a network issue than a Superset issue. You might want to check the following though:-
1. If your VM has a firewall, ensure that it allows inbound connections via the configured port.
2. When running the webserver, whether gunicorn or the development one, ensure you are listening on the interface 0.0.0.0:{port}. listening on localhost or 127.0.0.1 might also be a reason.
